text:
Tomcat 3.3 RPMs don't start up under RedHat 7.2.
The "nobody" account has /sbin/nologin as a default shell,
which prints the message:
"This account is currently not available."

For obscure reasons Henri decided to use the « nobody » user by default.

This is a bad idea for security reasons, tomcat should use its own user, i.e
tomcat like apache uses apache

However the scripts have all the necessary plumbing to use whatever user you
like : just create a tomcat user with /var/tomcat as root, a valid shell, change
the owner /var/log/tomcat and /var/spool/tomcat to tomcat.tomcat, and edit the
tomcat user in /var/tomcat/conf/tomcat.conf
creator: nicolas.mailhot@one2team.com
gbailey@lxpro.com
text:
Can't shutdown tomcat 3.3-2 with "service tomcat stop"

Looks like it's looking for ajp12.id in /etc/tomcat/conf ($TOMCAT_HOME)
instead of finding it in /var/spool/tomcat/ajp12.id ($TOMCAT_AJPID)

Did something break while trying to make this package FHS-compliant?

There is no obscure reason, just that on Redhat 6.2 boxes, Apache HTTP server 
use the nobody user. I was told that Redhat 7.x use an apache user now. The fix 
will be easy for these boxes :

replace nobody bu apache in /etc/tomcat/conf/tomcat.conf :

TOMCAT_USER="apache"

Then make all the dirs owned by nobody to be for apache user :

chown -R apache:apache /var/tomcat/modules/
chown -R apache:apache /var/tomcat/webapps/
chown -R apache:apache /var/tomcat/internal/
chown -R apache:apache /var/log/tomcat
chown -R apache:apache /var/spool/tomcat
chown -R apache:apache /var/spool/tomcat
